intro: Siphocampylus bilabiatus, commonly known as the two-lipped siphocampylus, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are finely divided and often have a strong, spicy scent. Siphocampylus bilabiatus is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its delicate appearance and pleasant fragrance.
